channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After His Democratic Victory in Texas, a New Working-Class Star Rises
item.description: Taylor Rehmet, a machinist and union leader, pulled off a stunning State Senate win in Fort Worth and its suburbs. He is among several political outsi...

item.title: ‘No one is illegal on stolen land’: how the Grammys turned into a giant Trump roast and ICE protest
item.description: Even Justin and Hailey Bieber, who don’t normally address American politics, wore protest pins about ICE.

item.title: How the Supreme Court Secretly Made Itself Even More Secretive
item.description: Amid calls to increase transparency and revelations about the court’s inner workings, the chief justice imposed nondisclosure agreements on clerks and...

item.title: Trump erupts about Trevor Noah joke linking him to Bill Clinton and Jeffrey Epstein: ‘I can’t speak for Bill, but I have never been to Epstein Island’
item.description: Trevor Noah's savage joke said Trump wants Greenland because "Epstein’s island is gone, he needs a new island to hang out with Bill Clinton."

item.title: Laura Fernández Wins Costa Rican Presidency
item.description: Laura Fernández’s victory was driven by a crisis in which Costa Rica’s reputation for peace has been tarred by record-breaking violence.

item.title: ‘The Chinese have invaded us in terms of merchandise’: Mexico and Argentina lead Latin America’s struggles with flood of imports
item.description: Temu averaged 114 million monthly active users in Latin America in the first half of 2025, a 165% increase year-on-year from 2024, Sensor Tower estima...

item.title: A 1987 Proposal Could Help Hold ICE to Account for Constitutional Violations
item.description: A proposal in a 1987 law review article could address a gap that makes it all but impossible to sue federal officials for violating the Constitution.

item.title: We Were Top Homeland Security Lawyers. You Can’t Wish Away the Fourth Amendment.
item.description: Forcibly entering homes with only administrative warrants is unconstitutional.

item.title: It’s so cold in Florida that iguanas are falling out of trees
item.description: “I think in South Florida you're going to see iguanas falling from trees, I mean a lot, once it gets under 40 degrees,” Gov. Ron DeSantis said.

item.title: Europe-wide army is a dumb idea, EU foreign policy chief says: ‘maybe those people haven’t really thought this through practically’
item.description: “If you are already part of NATO then you can’t create a separate army," Kaja Kallas said at a security conference in Norway.

item.title: Squeezed Between Trump and China, India Looks for Faraway Friendships
item.description: India is overcoming its aversion to free-trade deals to cozy up with Canada and other middle powers.

item.title: Right-Wing Populist Declares Victory in Costa Rica’s Presidential Election
item.description: Laura Fernández, the outgoing Costa Rican leader’s handpicked successor, declared victory in the country’s presidential election after preliminary res...

item.title: Gaza’s Rafah Crossing Reopens, Allowing Some to Leave and Return
item.description: Some critically ill and wounded Palestinians were set to leave through the Rafah crossing as it reopened on Monday. A limited number of Palestinians t...

item.title: Rafah Crossing in Gaza Reopens, Another Step for Fragile Cease-Fire
item.description: Israel and Egypt had disagreed for months about how to resume operations at the Rafah border crossing, which has been largely closed since May 2024.

item.title: Laura Fernández Wins Costa Rican Presidency
item.description: Laura Fernández’s victory was driven by a crisis in which Costa Rica’s reputation for peace has been tarred by record-breaking violence.
